newsitem.title: UK: Two police officers killed in Northern Ireland.
newsitem.headline: Two police officers killed in Northern Ireland.

text.p: Two police officers died on Monday after being shot in the town of Lurgan, south of Belfast, the BBC reported.
The officers were shot while on foot patrol in the town. Media reports said they had been shot in the head at close range.
Security sources said the incident happened just before 1100 GMT. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.
The British province has been tense for months after Irish Republican Army guerrillas abandoned a ceasefire and resumed attacks on security forces.
Pro-British Loyalist guerrillas have launched a series of retaliatory attacks on nationalists in the past year, killing two Catholics.
